p: New Zealand White rabbits have been demonstrated to be appropriate models for non-lethal WNV infections as only weanling rabbits demonstrate severe lesions and clinical symptoms [ 198]. Rabbits are also commonly used to generate antibodies against WNV which can be utilized in assays such as immunohistochemistry. Other species which have been examined as animal models for WNV infection include pigs, dog and cats [ 199, 200]. Experimental infection of snakes and bats failed to demonstrate significant viremia and disease [ 201, 202]. Young chicks have occasionally been used as models for avian infection as wild birds can be difficult to work with and require trapping and special care [ 203, 204, 205, 206, 207].
